Prerequisites: None.
Description:
Fundamental drawing and studio experiences; exploration of basic drawing ideas and media. Work produced in
class must be retained for later portfolio presentation in ART 30001.

Prerequisites: ARTF14000.
Description:
Continued practice in drawing with particular emphasis upon dimensional representation and pictorial structure.
Work produced in this class must be retained for later portfolio presenation in ART 30001.

Prerequisites: ARTF 14000; and ART 10022 and ART 10023.
Description:
An introduction to the basic concepts of three-dimensional form. Work produced in this course must be retained
for later portfolio presentation in ART 30001.

Prerequisites: ARTF 14000; and ART 10022 or ART 10023.
Description:
Opaque, water-based media used to introduce fundamental form language and vocabulary of painting. Emphasis
upon structured study and effective use of colors. Work produced in class must be retained for later portfolio
presentation in ART 30001.

Prerequisites: ARTF14001; and ART 10022 or ART 10023.
Description:
Emphasis on continued development of drawing with focus on nonfigurative representations of pictorial space.
Work produced in this course must be retained for later portfolio presentation in ART 30001.

Prerequisites: ART 10022, ART 10023,ARTF 14000, ARTF 14001, ARTF 14055, ARTF 14060, ARTH 22006, ARTH 22007, ARTF 24010 AND ARTF 24040.
Description:
Diagnostic review by fine arts faculty of portfolio of work selected from "foundation" courses. Student's
knowledge of art history is also examined. Student must receive a passing score (above average of C) to
continue in degree program. Action by faculty committee may include the assignment of additional studio work
over the normal graduation requirements in areas of apparent deficiencies.

Prerequisites: ARTF 14000; and ART 10022or ART 10023.
Description:
Introductory studiolecture course which introduces fine art photography with an aesthetic,contemporary
approach. Students learn traditional and digital photographic image-making applications and the historical
underpinnings of the photograph in modern art. Research paper and portfolio required. Work produced in this
class must be retained for later portfolio presentation in ART 30001.

Prerequisites: ARTF 14000; and ART 10022 or ART 10023.
Description:
Basic traditional and contemporary techniques of relief (woodcut, lino-cut, etc.) and intaglio printing (etching,
colography, etc.). Work produced in this class must be retained for later portfolio presentation in ART 30001.

Prerequisites: ARTF 14055, ART10022 and ART 20024.
Description: Continuation of sculpture I with greater emphasis on materials and processes.

Prerequisites: ARTF 14060, ART 10023 and ART20024.
Description:
Continuation of work begun in Painting I. Introduction to oil painting with emphasis upon direct painting from
observed sources and study of expressive capabilities of painting.

Prerequisites: ARTF 24001 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
Description:
Further study and understanding of concepts and ideas which enable the student to understand and
professionally realize their drawings.

Prerequisites: ARTF14000, ARTF14001and ARTF 24001; and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
Description:
(Repeatable for a total of 9 credit hours) Extensive studio practice of traditional and contemporary approaches to
the human figure. Critical analysis of the figure from the Renaissance through postmodernism. Students work
from a nude model.

Prerequisites: ARTF 24040, ART 10023 and ART 20024; and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
Description:
Continuation of ARTF 24040 emphasizing individually assigned problems in intaglio with introduction to color
intaglio techniques.

Prerequisites: ARTF 24040, ART 10023 andART 20024; and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
Description:
The initial presentation of fundamental concepts and processes pertaining to serigraphy. This course will include
printing techniques and aesthetic considerations in the making of art.

Prerequisites: ARTF 24040, ART 10023 and ART20024; and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
Description:
Introduction to stone lithography. Techniques of drawing and printing crayon, tusche, transfer and color images
and their relation to problems of drawing and composition.

Prerequisites: ARTF 24055 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
Description: (Repeatable for a maximum of 6 credit hours) Continuation of the study of the human figure in sculpture.

Prerequisites: ARTF 24055 and ARTF 24005 with a grade of S.
Description:
A sculpture course with an emphasis on other conceptual approaches beyond the more formal and aesthetic
considerations explored in Sculpture II.

Prerequisites: ARTF 24060 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
Description: Continuation of the painting experience in various media, using formal means of painting expressively.

Prerequisites: ARTF 34001 and a grade ofS in ARTF 24005.
Description: (Repeatable for a total of 9 credit hours) Continuation of ARTF 34001.

Prerequisites: ARTF 24010 and ARTF24005 with a grade of S.
Description:
Combined studio/lecture course offering more advanced, conceptual approaches to the contemporary
applications of photographic imaging for artists. Students work with larger scale printing formats, more involved
research and greater depth of involvement with the photographic medium.

Prerequisites: ART 10022 with a minimum C (2.000) grade.
Description:
(Slashed with ARTF 55011) Students develop their technical and conceptual skills in fine art digital photography,
and develop a contemporary approach to working with the medium. Students will explore various photographic
and digital techniques, and will form an awareness of such techniques in contemporary photography.

Prerequisites: ARTF 34040 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
Description: Continuation of ARTF 34040 with special emphasis on color and photographic techniques intaglio.

Prerequisites: ARTF 34041 and a gradeof S in ARTF 24005 and special approval.
Description: Continuation of ARTF 34041 emphasizing individually assigned projects.

Prerequisites: Choose two (2) from the following: ARTF 34040 or34041 or 34042 or 44040 or 44041 or 44042.
Description:
(Repeatable for a maximum of 9 credit hours) Advanced printmaking course with emphasis on students
producing new, individually conceived visual works in printmaking in close consultation with faculty. Written
proposal by students required at registration.

Prerequisites: ART 10022 with a minimum C (2.000) grade.
Description:
(Slashed with ARTF 44045) A distance learning course that combines video demonstrations and readings on
creating artists books for fine art studio artists and photographers. Some basic digital image manipulation and
studio skills with paper are needed for successful results. Students are required to digitally document their
projects and upload them for review before project deadlines. Specific materials and basic studio tools are
required to complete the projects.

Prerequisites: ARTF 34055 and agrade of S in ARTF 24005.
Description:
Advanced sculpture course with emphasis on students pursuing individually conceived problems in close
consultation with faculty. Written proposal by students required at registration.

Prerequisites: ARTF 34060 and a grade of S in ARTF 24005.
Description:
(Repeatable for a maximum of 9 credit hours) Advanced painting course with emphasis on students pursuing
individually conceived problems in close consultation with faculty. Written proposal by students required at
registration.

Course Name: FIELD EXPERIENCE:TRAVEL STUDY IN FINE ART
Prerequisites: Major in studio arts (STAR) or specialapproval of instructor.
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with ARTF 54092) Travel-based study/field experience in fine arts disciplines
to and at a site or sites away from Kent State University.

Prerequisites: A grade of S in ARTF 24005.
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) Special problems in studio art. Discussion, lecture and studio research in various selected
media and concepts. Content varies each semester offered.

Prerequisites: Major in studio arts (STAR) and special approval.
Description: (Repeatable for credit)Additional study in area of student's choice in consultation with advisor.

Prerequisites: Senior standing a grade of S in ARTF 24005 and special approval.
Description:
Independently conceived project by senior fine art major, including written artist statements culminating in an
exhibition and oral review.

Prerequisites: graduate standing.
Description:
(Slashed with ARTF 44011) Students develop their technical and conceptual skills in fine art digital photography,
and develop a contemporary approach to working with the medium. Students explore various photographic and
digital techniques and form an awareness of such techniques in contemporary photography.

Prerequisites: Master ofArts or Master of Fine Arts within the School of Art.
Description:
(Slahsed with ARTF 44045) Distance learning course on creating artist books for professional artists and
photographers. Basic material skills with paper and printing, drawing, design and or photography needed. Digital
photo documentation of works and uploading of files necessary for completion of course.

Prerequisites: Graduate standing.
Description:
(Repeatable for a maximum of 9 credit hours)Contemporary issues related to visual arts explored through
presentation, lecture and discussion. Guest speakers augment staff.

Course Name: FIELD EXPERIENCE:TRAVEL STUDY IN FINE ART
Prerequisites: Graduate standing in Fine Art or specialapproval by instructor.
Description:
(Repeatable for credit) (Cross-listed with ARTF 44092) Travel-based study/field experience in fine arts disciplines
to and at a site or sites away from Kent State University.

Prerequisites: Special approval and graduatestanding.
Description: Continued development on a personal direction in printmaking.

Prerequisites: Graduate standing.
Description: Continued development of a personal direction in sculpture.

Prerequisites: Special approval and graduate standing.
Description: Individual study, painting.

Prerequisites: graduate standing in MA or MFA program in fine art.
Description: (Repeatable for credit) Independent study in drawing, painting, printmaking or sculpture. IP Permissible.

Prerequisites: Graduate standing.
Description: (Repeatable for credit)Studio research in the visual arts.
